materials.raw_text: Arsenic (As): 450 g, Phosphorus (P): 30 g, Zirconium (Zr): 1200 g, Oxygen (O): 300 g (from oxidizing agents), additional silica as binder: 150 g.

sourcing.instructions: Arsenic: Chemical supply stores or specialty chemical suppliers; Phosphorus: Chemical supply stores or online chemical retailers; Zirconium: Metal suppliers or online metal retailers; Oxygen: Purchase as part of an oxidizing agent like potassium nitrate from chemical suppliers; Silica: Construction supply stores or online.
steps: Arsenic: Chemical supply stores or specialty chemical suppliers; Phosphorus: Chemical supply stores or online chemical retailers; Zirconium: Metal suppliers or online metal retailers; Oxygen: Purchase as part of an oxidizing agent like potassium nitrate from chemical suppliers; Silica: Construction supply stores or online.

1. In a fume hood, carefully weigh 450 g of arsenic and 30 g of phosphorus. 2. In a separate container, weigh 1200 g of zirconium. 3. Weigh 300 g of the oxidizing agent and 150 g of silica. 4. Mix the arsenic and phosphorus thoroughly in a glass container to ensure a homogenous blend. 5. Gradually add the zirconium to the arsenic-phosphorus mix while stirring continuously. 6. Slowly incorporate the oxidizing agent and silica into the mixture, ensuring uniform distribution. 7. Transfer the mixture into a crucible suitable for high-temperature applications.
preparation.raw_text: 1. In a fume hood, carefully weigh 450 g of arsenic and 30 g of phosphorus. 2. In a separate container, weigh 1200 g of zirconium. 3. Weigh 300 g of the oxidizing agent and 150 g of silica. 4. Mix the arsenic and phosphorus thoroughly in a glass container to ensure a homogenous blend. 5. Gradually add the zirconium to the arsenic-phosphorus mix while stirring continuously. 6. Slowly incorporate the oxidizing agent and silica into the mixture, ensuring uniform distribution. 7. Transfer the mixture into a crucible suitable for high-temperature applications.

steps: Heat the crucible in a furnace to 800°C for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction and synthesis of the compound.
heating.raw_text: Heat the crucible in a furnace to 800°C for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction and synthesis of the compound.

steps: After heating, turn off the furnace and let the crucible cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 6-8 hours). Avoid rapid cooling to prevent cracking.
cooling.raw_text: After heating, turn off the furnace and let the crucible cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 6-8 hours). Avoid rapid cooling to prevent cracking.

steps: Once cooled, carefully remove the solid sample from the crucible. If necessary, grind the material to achieve a finer consistency. Sand the edges and surfaces to smooth out any rough areas. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability and chemical resistance. Allow the sealant to cure for 24 hours before use.
